_sText:
:: Here it comes. A small CS:S ZM remake (or, better to say, reinterpretation) of zm_toxic_house by NaVy (can be found here).

:: This is my first map for Source engine. Overall, it took nearly month and half to finish it. I started from scratch and made house planning similar to that of original. As you can see, there are also some new areas - a basement with two floors, right under the house, small underground stream and cliff side with nice sea view.

Map features ::
- :: Interiors / exteriors / underground areas.
- :: Cubemaps compiled.
- :: No soda machines.
- :: High cliff to throw zombies from.
- :: Sharp rocks down there to turn zombies into a red pudding.
- :: Humans may be thrown at rocks as well.
- :: Doing so is strongly recommended.
- :: No flying nicknames.
- :: No wall-pasted nicknames.
- :: No annoying nicknames at all.
- :: Sugar-free.
- :: Zombie-free *

:: Although there are 64 spawns on this map for compatibility reasons, I won't recommend to play it with more than 40-45 players. There is simply not enough space to have a good game with so many players.

:: Also, I must note that with HDR lighting and sunny day-style lighting this map looks a lot better, - both interiors and exteriors. But since this is ZM map, it would look a little weird to meet zombie horde walking under the sun. And regardless of it's prettiness, HDR lighting almost doubles map file size. So I thought i'm better off without it. If you still want to have a HDR version, just ask me and I'll make it.

:: Interiors (excluding basement) are sealed off with areaportals/areaportalwindows. Overall, this brings a bit lower, but a much more stable fps, especially outside the house. These screenshots were taken on my 4-year-old laptop. Nevertheless you can see that fps is pretty nice.

:: Still I feel like I've forgot to mention something. Nevermind. If you have any questions, bugs found or suggestions for my further maps, let me know.

* This applies to uninfected map. In case of infection we take no responsibility for zombie appearing.
